This movie tells the story of Alan Turing, a British mathematician who is credited with cracking the German Enigma code during World War II. The movie explores Turing's troubled private life, his relationship with his beautiful and talented young mistress, Elizabeth Turing (played by Elizabeth Debicki), and his struggle to come to terms with his own homosexuality. The movie also explores Turing's contributions to cracking the German Enigma code during World War II, including his famous "Turing test" of whether someone is really a machine or a human. The movie ends with a touching scene in which Turing (played by Benedict Cumberbatch) visits his beautiful and talented young mistress, Elizabeth Turing (played by Elizabeth Debicki), and expresses his deep love for her. The scene ends with the two lovers embracing each other tightly, expressing their deep love for each other.
